comments:
Environment WID v6.0.1.2 / plugin org.eclipse.jdt.core_version_3.0.2
I changed in WID v6.0.1.2  the configuration of: Window --> Preferences --> Java --> Compiler.
The next time I reopened the Preferences I got following error message inside a separate window: COULD NOT ACCEPT CHANGES: 'The currently displayed page contains invalid values'.
Inside .metadata\.log file I saw following error messages:
!MESSAGE This plug-in (located at "c:\sdp\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.0.1.1") was ignored because another version of the same plug-in (located at "c:\sdp\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.0.2") was picked.
....
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 10001 Okt 13, 2006 16:00:02.765
!MESSAGE preference option missing: org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.debug.sourceFile (org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.CompilerConfigurationBlock)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 10001 Okt 13, 2006 16:00:02.765
!MESSAGE preference option missing: org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.codegen.unusedLocal (org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.CompilerConfigurationBlock)
....
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.CompilerConfigurationBlock.validateMaxNumberProblems(Unknown Source)at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.CompilerConfigurationBlock.validateSettings(Unknown Source)at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.CompilerConfigurationBlock.createContents(Unknown Source)at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.CompilerPreferencePage.createContents(Unknown Source)at
org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferencePage.createControl(Unknown Source)
....
I can't change the settings of .../java/compiler because a build is necessary and it aborts. The only way to get back a working workspace is to create a new one. The problem could not reproduced a second time but there is another link describing the same issue:
http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.newcomer/msg00961.html

I'm not sure if we still provide bug fixes for these builds.
I wasn't aware of that bug, and I'm quite sure we would have seen that as well.

Can you send me the output of 'Help > About > Configuration Details?'

When you open the preference page and the error is shown, is it possible to change values? If yes, can you change the 'Maximum number...' on the Java > Compiler> Advanced tab?

I don't know whats the state here
- I never was able to reproduce the failure
- we could provide safety code that avoided the exception
- there's a special procedure for 3.0.2 fixes. I was expecting to here more from corresponding team
